div1.note: CARL S. MILLIKEN, Secretary of State.

N. B. — This blank must be signed in two places by the President and Secretary and acknowledged before a Notary Public; the corporate seal should be attached and the report filed in the office of SECRETARY OF STATE, DENVER, COLORADO, within sixty days next after January first. (See extracts of Act on back hereof.)

Total Tax and penalty
Fee for filing report

div1.head: ANNUAL REPORT
MISCELLANEOUS
div1.ab: Indicate below if Foreign or Domestic.
Domestic (Incorporated under the laws of the State of Colorado.)
Foreign (Incorporated under the laws of the State of _____)

The COL. W.F. CODY ('BUFFALO BILL') HISTORICAL PICTURES COMPANY.
(Name of Corporation)
FIRST: Names of Officers and their several places of business.

list.item: Business Address Denver Post, Post Bldg., Denver, Colo.
Business Address Denver Post, Post Bldg., Denver, Colorado.
Person in charge of office where books are kept outside of State

div1.ab: SECOND: Names of Directors or Trustees, with the residence and business address of each:

F.G. Bonfils, 1500 East 1oth. Ave., and Denver Post, Post Building, Denver, Colorado; H.H. Tammen, 1061 Humboldt Street, and Denver Post, Post Building, Denver, Colorado; George K. Spoor, Chicago, Illinois; V.R. Day, Chicago, Illinois, and Louis Levand, Brown Palace Hotel, and Denver Post, Post Building, Denver, Colorado.
THIRD: Total amount of capital stock as fixed and determined by articles of incorporation and amendments thereto $ 12,000.00

list.item: Amount of increased capital stock, if any, $ none.
Date of amendment to increase capital stock none
Amount of decrease of capital stock, if any, $ none
Date of amendment to decrease capital stock none
That portion of said capital stock represented by its corporate capital, property and assets, located and employed in the State of Colorado $ none

div1.ab: FOURTH: The proportion of said capital stock actually paid in $ 12,000.00
FIFTH: Setting forth how the same was paid:

list.item: Amount by purchase of property $ None

div1.ab: SIXTH: Amount of indebtedness at date of filing this report $ None, excepting current expenses.
SEVENTH: State whether or not engaged in active operation within the State of Colorado: Yes.

EIGHTH: Such other information as will show with reasonable fullness and certainty the condition of real and personal property, and the financial condition of your company at the date of filing this report

This Company was organized for the purpose of producing historical motion pictures and other screen productions and as in the articles of incorporation provided; the Company at great expense produced a number of historical motion pictures, principally battle scenes in the wars between the United States and the American Indians, some of these pictures being authorized by the War Department and participated in by the United States troops and different Indian tribes with the approval of the Secretary of the Department of the Interior. The business of the Compnay was interfered with by the coming on of the World's War, in so far as exhibiting such pictures in foreign countries or even successfully in the United States, and for these reasons the business has not been pressed until recently.
div1.p: In Witness Whereof, The President of the said corporation has hereunto set his hand and caused the corporate seal to be affixed this 25th day of September, A. D. 1922
div1.ab: CORPORATE SEAL
div1.closer:
Attest: H H Tammen
Secretary.
F G Bonfils
President.

div1.p: Before me, _______, a Notary Public in and for said County and State, personally appeared F.G. Bonfils, President and H.H. Tammen, Secretary of The Col. W.F. Cody ('Buffalo Bill') Historical Pictures Company. personally known to me to be the persons whose names are subscribed to the foregoing annual report of said corporation, who each being first duly sworn, upon his oath deposes and says, each for himself and not one for the other, that he is the President and Secretary, respectively, of the said The Col. W.F. Cody ('Buffalo Bill') Historical Pictures Company and that the facts thus set forth in said annual report are true, full and complete, and that they as such President and Secretary, respectively, of the said corporation, made, signed and delivered the said annual report in compliance with the statute in such case made and provided.
div1.ab: CORPORATE SEAL

F G Bonfils
President.

H H Tammen
Secretary.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 25th day of September, A. D. 1922
My commission expires May 22nd, A. D. 1923
NOTARY SEAL

Arthur M Weideman
Notary Public.

figure.p: Arthur M. Weideman City & County of Denver, Colo. NOTARY PUBLIC
